title: France rugby union team: Fixtures, squad and head coach
snippet: A distinguished former player himself, receiving 64 international caps for Les Bleus as a scrum-half between 1991 and 2003, Fabien Galthie became France head coach in 2019. Galthie led France to the Six Nations Grand Slam in 2022 with his coaching philosophy for the team revolving around an emphasis on 'French flair and fight'. The France national rugby union team typically wear an iconic all blue home kit, with red and white details aligning with the colours of the country's flag.

title: Fabien Galthié - Wikipedia
snippet: Galthié was a crucial member of the French team that upset New Zealand in the semifinal of the 1999 Rugby World Cup at Twickenham. In 2000, Colomiers reached the French championship final, but Galthié had to watch from the stands due to a knee injury. The club lost 28–23 to Stade Français, whom he joined the following season. In 2001 Galthié was appointed captain of France. A successful year in 2002, including a Six Nations Grand Slam, saw France dominate the 2002 IRB Awards, with Galthié named Player of the Year, as well as French coach Bernard Laporte being named Coach of the Year.
